About Me


Natasha is a Production Engineer with more than five years of experience in textile manufacturing, operations, quality and inventory management. Currently pursuing an MBA at University Canada West in Vancouver, she is transitioning into data-informed roles in operations, analytics and supply chain.


Her strength lies in structuring processes, collaborating with cross-functional teams and communicating complex information in a clear and practical way.

title: Projects
text:
Selection of academic and professional projects related to operations, analytics and leadership.




Defect Reduction & Quality Optimization


Operations & Continuous Improvement


Led a continuous-improvement initiative to reduce production defects across the socks division. Used Excel-based analytics to identify defect patterns, streamline inspection points, and implement standardized quality checks across shifts.

Achieved a 22% reduction in defect rate within three months.
Introduced visual controls and quick-check audits per shift.
Improved coordination between quality, production, and logistics teams to reduce rework.






Lean operations Quality control Root-cause analysis




Supplier On-Time Delivery Performance Improvement


Supply Chain & Vendor Management


Developed and implemented a supplier performance enhancement program. Analyzed historical delivery data, built on-time performance dashboards, and renegotiated delivery schedules with key vendors.

Improved supplier on-time delivery by +12 percentage points.
Implemented a performance-tracking dashboard for the supply chain team.
Reduced production delays caused by raw-material shortages.






Vendor management KPI dashboards Logistics coordination




Logistics Cost Optimization Project


Supply Chain Cost & Efficiency Analysis


Built a logistics cost model to analyze freight spending, route efficiency, and shipment consolidation opportunities. Used Excel simulations to compare current vs.Â optimized logistics scenarios.

Achieved an estimated CAD $3,600 monthly cost reduction.
Optimized transportation routes and consolidated light shipments.
Improved cost visibility for strategic decision-making.






Cost optimization Supply chain modeling Excel modeling
